article.headline: Savannah State 54, Southern Miss 52
article.story: SAVANNAH, Ga. (AP) -- Chris Linton made a jumper with 9 seconds remaining to lift Savannah State to a 54-52 upset over Southern Miss on Saturday night. The Tigers (7-13) won only their ninth game in 110 played against Division I teams since joining the highest division in 2002. The Golden Eagles (10-3) took a 45-39 lead with 8:40 remaining in the second half when Sai'Quon Stone scored on a layup and Jarvis Hill made a 3-pointer. Savannah State tied the game at 50-50 after Joshua Obiajunwa made a layup then a foul shot with 2:29 left. Then the Tigers went up by two points on another layup by Obiajunwa, who led his team with 17 points and seven rebounds. Southern Miss evened the score on Craig Craft's jumper with 24 seconds left, then Linton answered with his game-winning jumper. Golden Eagles guard Bryson Brewer attempted a 3-pointer, but missed to preserve Savannah State's victory. Joseph Flegler scored 11 points, while Lazarius Coleman added 10 points for the Tigers. Southern Miss was led by Jeremy Wise, who scored 16 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
